instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2879 switching off
820-2879 switching off
threads.message:
Did you try SMC bypass mode?
Does it turn off w/ and w/o battery connected?

Post exact resistance (ohm scale) to ground at L6995.

threads.title: 820-2879 switching off
threads.message:
L6995 3.630K in reference to the ground.

SMC bypass works, but the mac keeps turning off unexpectedly both on the ASD TEST screen and when initializing the system. 

It shuts down without the battery connected? yes.

threads.title: 820-2879 switching off
threads.message:
3.6K at L6995 to ground can mean bad MCP.
Normal value is more than 30K.

threads.title: 820-2879 switching off
threads.message:
Sorry I don't know what "MCP" means.
Isn't it worth it?

threads.title: 820-2879 switching off
threads.message:
"I don't know what "MCP" means"
Look at U1400 in page 2.
MCP stands from Multi Chip Package (embedded south, north, graphics, DDR control functions).

BTW, Intel also noted its chips like MCP and SOC (System On Chip) for newer ones.

MCP89 is an old chip, very tired really.
You can find working boards on Aliexpress very cheap.
But keep in mind, the MCP can die in any moment.
